official_title: A bill to establish a Federal Strategic Drug Intelligence Center.

summary.text: Strategic Drug Intelligence Act of 1989 - Establishes an executive agency to be known as the Strategic Drug Intelligence Center to: (1) assimilate the collective data, intelligence, and analytical capabilities of National Drug Control Program agencies; (2) analyze foreign and domestic drug trafficking organizations and their operations; (3) create and maintain a state-of-the-art computer data base for drug-related strategic intelligence; and (4) disseminate comprehensive intelligence on drug organizations to appropriate intelligence and enforcement agencies. Provides for the establishment of a Strategic Drug Intelligence Board to be responsible for the management of the Center. Specifies the composition and responsibilities of the Board. Requires the Director of National Drug Control Policy to develop and submit to the Congress a plan for the management of the Center which shall include a design and format for each of the data bases to be established by the Center. Specifies that such plan shall utilize existing intelligence resources and shall not duplicate current information systems. Requires: (1) specified agencies to participate in the establishment of the data bases and contribute data as required by the Board; and (2) the information in each data base established by the Center to be made available to appropriate representatives from participating agencies. Directs the Board to take reasonable, necessary actions to provide for physical and personnel security. Requires the Director, within a year and by March 1 of each year thereafter, to prepare and submit to the Congress a report evaluating the performance of the Center and the participation of each of the contributors of the data bases of the Center. Authorizes appropriations for FY 1991 through 1994.
